bioghist.p: Robert Waln, state legislator and US Congressman from Philadelphia, officer of several Philadelphia business and cultural organizations, began his business career as a shipping merchant in 1785. In 1791 he formed a partnership with his cousin Jesse Waln. Robert Waln withdrew from the firm in 1805, continuing once again on his own.

scopecontent.p: Among the Waln papers are Robert Waln letterbooks, 1784-90, 1800-19 (3 v.), ledger, 1791-1806; Jess and Robert Waln letterbooks, 1798-1806. The letterbooks concern trade with England, Lisbon and other European ports, West Indies, East Indies (Batavia) and China. Robert Waln's ledger and some of the letters relate to his personal business. Robert Waln, Jr., was an author and poet who is here represented by his notes (14 v.) on China. His observations, which were made while visiting in 1819, and extracts taken from prvevious studies were in preparation for "China: a history and description of China and U.S. commercial and diplomatic activities," [short version of title] published in 1823. There is also a topically arranged bibliography for politics, economy, religion, sciences, history, and literature.
